chapter.title: Reserved diagnostic TOKENs
chapter.para: Reserved TOKENs were used for diagnostic extensions to EXPs, to avoid adding new constructs the contents of an existing UNIT. All other parts of the diagnostic system occur in other UNITs.

section.title: ~exp_to_source
section.programlisting: body: EXP sh from: SOURCEMARK to: SOURCEMARK -> EXP sh
section.para: Records that the EXP body arose from translating program between SOURCEMARK from and SOURCEMARK to (inclusive).

section.title: ~diag_id_source
section.programlisting: body: EXP sh name: TDFSTRING(k, n) access: EXP POINTER(al) type: DIAG_TYPE -> EXP sh
section.para: Within the EXP body a variable named name of DIAG_TYPE type can be accessed via the EXP access.

section.title: ~diag_type_scope
section.programlisting: body: EXP sh name: TDFSTRING(k, n) type: DIAG_TYPE -> EXP sh
section.para: Within the EXP body a source language type named name of DIAG_TYPE type is valid.

section.title: ~diag_tag_scope
section.programlisting: body: EXP sh name: TDFSTRING(k, n) type: DIAG_TYPE -> EXP sh
